thread.title: These College Students Had a Rat Problem, So They Unmercifully Blasted It Out of the House
thread.title_full: These College Students Had a Rat Problem, So They Unmercifully Blasted It Out of the House

author: jkatzowitz@thedailydot.com (Josh Katzowitz)
title: These College Students Had a Rat Problem, So They Unmercifully Blasted It Out of the House
text:
Screengrabs via Jody Mackin/Twitter BTW 
When you’re trying to drive a rat out of your home, there are a few ways to go about handling the job. You can set up traps, feed them rat poison, set a slice of pizza outside your front door, or call an exterminator to handle the problem for you. 
Or you can go DIY, set up some barriers and slap the crap out of it with a broom. Just like these Duquesne University students did. Here’s your pest removal inspiration for the day. We came up with this ridiculous plan to get this rat out of our house and IT ACTUALLY WORKED!!!! BYE BITCH pic.twitter.com/c5qW76mzP8 — Jody Mackin (@jodeball4REALZ) February 17, 2017 If you thought that surprising slap shot as the rat flopped down the stairs was fitting for an NHL arena, you’re not alone. Here’s what happens if legendary hockey play-by-play announcer Doc Emrick calls the action. doc emrick calls the rat getting thrown out of a house pic.twitter.com/uFgkBmCFYt — Ron Konkoma (@andymoney69) February 18, 2017 All of which reminds us: If you have a problem, you can usually solve it with a mop, a broom, and lightning-quick front-door reflexes.
